metadata.Title: CVE-2010-1167 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
fetchmail 4.6.3 through 6.3.16, when debug mode is enabled, does not properly handle invalid characters in a multi-character locale, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption and application crash) via a crafted (1) message header or (2) POP3 UIDL list.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-1167` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

fetchmail - 6.3.17-4ubuntu1
fetchmailconf - 6.3.17-4ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fetchmail package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.3.17-4ubuntu1').
